description: Rebuilds the specified WorkSpace. You cannot rebuild a WorkSpace unless its state is AVAILABLE, ERROR, UNHEALTHY, STOPPED, or REBOOTING. Rebuilding a WorkSpace is a potentially destructive action that can result in the loss of data. For more information, see Rebuild a WorkSpace. This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely rebuilt.

parameters.name: RebuildWorkspaceRequests
parameters.description: The WorkSpace to rebuild. You can specify a single WorkSpace. (dict) --- Describes the information used to rebuild a WorkSpace. WorkspaceId (string) --- The identifier of the WorkSpace.

nested_items.name: FailedRequests
nested_items.description: Information about the WorkSpace that could not be rebuilt.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.
